definition: to see each other/to meet in person
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity
when the enemies come face to face, their eyes blaze with hatred (idiom)
pinyin: chou2 ren2 xiang1 jian4 , fen4 wai4 yan3 hong2

definition: to get to know each other/acquaintance
to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to have no opportunity/no way (of doing sth)/no chance/no connection/not placed (in a competition)/(in pop lyrics) no chance of love, no place to be together etc
to meet again/until we meet again/goodbye
